column2: No algae- cloudy- wavy water- light breeze. 67 degrees F.
Ice off 5-2-97- weather sunny.  1 pair of loons- 1 eagle.
The weather is partly sunny.  One pair of loons with two babies- and one snapping turtle.  Rain gauge reading from 6/15 to 6/19 = 3.0 inches.
Partly sunny.  Rain gauge reading from 7/19/97 to 7/20/97= 0.2 inches.
The weather is overcast and there is a crane.
Sunny and 70 degrees F.  Wind is 10 mph.
Partly cloudy and 88 degrees F.  Wind is 10 mph.
Sunny and 84 degrees F.  Wind is 5 mph.
Partly cloudy and 80 degrees F.  Wind is 5 mph.
Partly cloudy and wind 15 mph.  70 degrees F.
Partly cloudy and 48 degrees F. wind is calm.
Cloudy- wind 5 mph sw. bottom at 38'.
Cloudy- west wind 15 mph. 2 loons with 2 babies.
Clear- wind 20 mph ne. two loons with two babies. bottom at 32 feet.
Sunny 10.5" of rain fell one week before in 3 hours. lake rose 3 feet.
Partly cloudy- calm. two loons with two babies. bottom at 40 feet.
Sunny- wind NE 10 mph. lots of turtles.
Preceeded by much rain- saw geese- no loons seen
Loons had hatched one then lost it. Previous ten years never failed to raise 2 to adult.
Loon seen with half grown baby.
Loons with 2 babies out for a week.
Loon family with 2 babies. Eagle flew by chased by 2 small birds.
water level down 6 inches from level in spring. Record dry summer.
Extra dry weather. Two loons with 2 babies.

column1: Family of loons spotted (2 adults- 2 young)

column2: After heavy rain- unusual weed growth. Extra hot summer. Two loon babies now full grown.
Loon with 2 little ones. Late hatch. Seen first end of June
Nesting loons gone. No young hatched. First failure in memory

column1: Spotted coontail- NWM- spatterdock- and white water lilies.

column2: Partly cloudy- loon nexting on island.
Clear and calm. Two baby loons observed on 7/02. Hatched on 7/02. Both still doing well.
Clear and almost calm. Only 1 baby loon has survived. Healthy and still with parents.
Partly cloudy. Young loon and parent still on lake.
Calm; overcast mainly with  brief periods of sun; loon present in nest
Partly cloudy; two baby loons present- disappeared within next couple days
Light NW wind; lightly overcast with occasional patches of blue sky

column1: Loon on nest as of 5/16/15- no on 6/16/15
Loon re-nested; female w/ 2 chicks on back observed 7/08/2015
Only 1 loon chick survived.  Observed regularly with parents

column2: Mostly sunny and calm.  Loons swimming near island where they nest.
Mostly sunny and calm.  Loons swimming near island where they nest.
Partly cloudy and calm.  No baby loons observed.
Partly cloudy and calm.  No baby loons observed.
Partly cloudy; light NW wind.  One baby loon and 9 adults observed.
Partly cloudy; light NW wind.  One baby loon and 9 adults observed.
Sunny- calm.  Loons (1 adult- one juvenile) observed
Sunny- calm.  Loons (1 adult- one juvenile) observed.
Mostly sunny. Winds were W- NW. Loons nested unsuccessfully this year. Likely due to high water
Partly cloudy and calm. One loon observed
Clear. Winds were W- SW. Large quantities of aquatic vegetation.
Clear and calm. Large quantities of aquatic vegetation.
